title:
Inherently Robust Economic Model Predictive Control Without
  Dissipativity
abstract:
We establish sufficient conditions for the terminal cost and constraint such
that economic model predictive control (MPC) is robustly recursively feasible
and economically robust to small disturbances without any assumptions of
dissipativity. Moreover, we demonstrate that these sufficient conditions can be
satisfied with standard design methods. A small example is presented to
illustrate the inherent robustness of economic MPC to small disturbances.
